intro: Gomesa fuscans, commonly known as the dark gomesa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, fuzzy texture. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Gomesa fuscans is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
